1.q_string: Which of the following is a redox reaction?

q_option: For ions, oxidation number is equal to the charge on the ion.
The oxidation number of oxygen is \(-2\) in all of its compound.
The oxidation number of fluorine is \(-1\) in all of its compounds.
Oxidation number of hydrogen is \(+1\) except in binary hydrides of alkali metals and alkaline earth metals where it is \(-1\).
1.q_string: Which of the following is not a rule for calculating oxidation number?

One atom of an element \(X\) weighs \(6.644 \times 10^{-23}\).

Calculate the number of gram atoms in $40 \mathrm{~kg}$ of it.

A \(10.0 \mathrm{~g}\) a sample of a mixture of calcium chloride and sodium chloride is treated with \(\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{CO}_{3}\) to precipitate the calcium as calcium carbonate. This \(\mathrm{CaCO}_{3}\) is heated to convert all the calcium to \(\mathrm{CaO}\) and the final mass of \(\mathrm{CaO}\) is \(1.62 \mathrm{gms}\). The \(\%\) by mass of \(\mathrm{CaCl}_{2}\) in the original mixture is :
How many millilitres of \(0.5 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}\) are needed to dissolve \(0.5 \mathrm{~g}\) of copper (II) carbonate?
